intro: Cyrtandromoea subintegra, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a small, flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit, often forming dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with a deep root system and water-storing tissues. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on xerophytic adaptations.
